abstract: Wells Fargo, which reported a $2.55 billion loss on Wednesday, said it wrote off $294 million in the fourth quarter because some of its customers were wiped out by the disgraced financier Bernard L. Madoff’s reputed $50 billion Ponzi scheme and were unable to pay their loans.

headline.main: Wells Fargo Says Madoff Scheme Cost It $294 Million
